title: The Phishy Waters of Cyber Bay

nodes.speaker: Professor Fishbuster
nodes.text: Ahoy! I'm Professor Fishbuster, master of the Anti-Phish arts. The Hacker Lord is sending fake emails to reel people in! Have you heard of phishing?

options.text: Yes! I'm a cyber fisher myself!

nodes.speaker: Hacker Lord
nodes.text: Hehe… If you really know phishing, answer this: You receive an email promising free diamonds if you click the link. What do you do?

nodes.speaker: Hacker Lord
nodes.text: Bwahaha! Your treasure is MINE! You bit the bait!

nodes.speaker: Professor Fishbuster
nodes.text: Well done! Free diamonds rarely exist… except maybe in Minecraft. Let me teach you more.

nodes.speaker: Professor Fishbuster
nodes.text: Phishing is when attackers trick you into giving up secrets—like passwords or your candy stash—by pretending to be someone you trust.

nodes.speaker: Professor Fishbuster
nodes.text: To survive the Phishy Waters, you must spot suspicious signs! Which sign do you want to learn first?

nodes.speaker: Professor Fishbuster
nodes.text: Sneaky links hide under harmless words. Always hover to check! If the address looks like `paypaI.com` (with a capital i), RUN!

nodes.speaker: Professor Fishbuster
nodes.text: Check the sender name! An email from `security@amaz0n-help.ru` is NOT Amazon—unless Amazon moved to .ru.

nodes.speaker: Professor Fishbuster
nodes.text: Phishers love panic! 'ACCOUNT CLOSING IN 5 MINUTES!!!' Stay calm. Real companies rarely scream at you.

nodes.speaker: Professor Fishbuster
nodes.text: You get an email claiming 'Your bank account is locked—verify now!' What do you do?

options.text: Click the link and sign in
Go to the official website to check

nodes.speaker: Hacker Lord
nodes.text: SLURP—your data is delicious! You just handed me your password! Next time, think twice!

nodes.speaker: Professor Fishbuster
nodes.text: Excellent! Always double-check by going straight to the official site or app. The Hacker Lord hates careful people!

nodes.speaker: Professor Fishbuster
nodes.text: Ignoring is better than clicking, but checking is BEST. Also… nice pizza.

nodes.speaker: Professor Fishbuster
nodes.text: Before you go, one more test: A friend messages you for money and says they lost their phone. What do you do?

options.text: Contact them through another channel to confirm

nodes.speaker: Professor Fishbuster
nodes.text: Bravo! Phishers often pretend to be people you trust. Always double-check! You swim safely in Cyber Bay!

nodes.speaker: Hacker Lord
nodes.text: Muahaha! You got hooked again! Another snack for me in Cyber Bay!

nodes.speaker: Professor Fishbuster
nodes.text: Story <The Phishy Waters of Cyber Bay> complete! Stay sharp, hero—there’s always another hook in the water!

nodes.speaker: System
nodes.text: (A new article <Phishing Learn Guide> is now in your Traveler's journal.)
